DOC.brief_summary: This is a prospective randomized clinical trial to determine where is the optimal location for local anesthetic injection for ultrasound guided interscalene nerve blocks. The investigators are investigating if local anesthetic deposited between the nerve roots is more effective than local anesthetic deposited in the interscalene groove.
DOC.brief_title: Optimal Location of Local Anesthetic Injection for Ultrasound Guided Interscalene Block
DOC.criteria: ASA III patients who are 18 years and older and who are scheduled for shoulder arthroscopy are eligible for enrollment provided they do not have any of the following exclusion criteria. chronic pain high preoperative opioid requirement age < 18 years old nonEnglish speaking contraindication to regional anesthesia (allergy to local anesthetics, coagulopathy, severe thrombocytopenia, preexisting neuropathy in operative limb, infection at puncture site) need for postoperative nerve function monitoring patient refusal dementia pulmonary disease or low baseline oxygen saturation
